Posts.Content: kimvidito wrote: Hi everyone I saw my radiation specialist yesterday. She was very nice. I will be getting about 6 weeks of radiation. She explained do to my age 38 yrs and the type of cancer I have (spindal cell metaplastic carcenoma stage 2 grade 3)they have to be a little more aggressive. She did not tell me much about my cancer but explained that this cancer does not follow lymph nodes and could be very aggressive. They did a scope in my nose (this makes you want to sneeze) right away because I've had a lump in my throat for a while. Everything looked good. They are sending me for many tests, bone scan, heart test and many ultrasounds. I'm greatful for that because the things you think about are crazy. This will put my mind at ease. She thinks that the oncologist will tell me about 5 rounds of chemo starting in 2 weeks. I will be off work for 6-8 months. I am glad everything has started. Bring it on!!!! I will let you guys know the results of my tests. I am so glad I found this site as you all help my journey a little less scary. hugs to all and you are all in my prayers. Kim Kim Metaplastic carcinoma, stage 2 , 2cm tumor, grade 3 triple neg Dx 4/11/2007, 2cm, Stage II, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Here we go!!! kimvidito Ka-Loni

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2007 08:24AM kimvidito wrote: Hi everyone I did have a melt down last week.  Everything scared me.  I was afraid to die and get sick again.  I finished my rads on wednesday and I think that is what brought on my anxiety.  Don't we all as women get hit with the anxiety after the fact.  What the heck just happened to me?????  We got hit with the reality that we are not going to live forever.  Everyone gets sick at one time or another from something be it an infection, heart disease or Lupus.  You can die from that too!!!!!!  I saw my therapist and she recomended this book Dancing in Limbo:  Making Sense of Life After Cancer by Halverson-Boyd and Hunter.  You can get the book from Indigo Chapters.   We have to live for today and not think about the future.  I know this is hard but it keeps you sane.  My son inspires me every day.  He has the challenge of living with a terrible disease, Lupus.  He now needs his hips replaced as the meds caused bone death in his hip.  He said that it's OK if he needs surgery and he will now have a bionic hip.LOL   He will be able to walk and run.  He advocates for Lupus all the time and we hosted a walk for lupus last weekend with his friends and raised over 600$.  Pouring your heart into something that makes a difference also helps us heal.  Yoga, meditating and eating well, exercising, this all helps.  Live your life to the fullest.   Sorry for the preaching but this is what helped my meltdown last week.  Thought I would share prayers out to you all Kim
Posts.Title: Anyone anxious at end of rads treatment? Stressin67 arnica

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2009 10:43AM kimvidito wrote: Hi My oncologist does the same.  I am anxiously awaiting results of my breast MRI and cat scan of chest and abdomen.  They never call me and let me know.  They wait until my apt to give me any news.  In the meantime, I feel awful and in pain... My husband and kids worry!!!  I hate that.  They seem to busy and their caring is out the window. take care Kim

Posts.Content: Oct 11, 2007 09:27AM kimvidito wrote: Hi everyone I am also having lightheadeness or dizziness.  It comes later in the week and goes away on the weekend.  One time I almost fainted at the cancer center.  I am going to mention this to my radiologist on Monday.  I feel much better than with chemo but it does scare me.  I get it mostly if I move my head too fast or stand up for too long. Kim

Posts.Content: kimvidito wrote: Hi everyone My complaint is more due to family problems. I live about 5 hours away from any relatives. My husband and 2 children and I live in a fairly small community and we are alone. I thought that I would get support through all of this but I was wrong. My mom and dad had a big Canada day party this weekend and everyone went. I couldn't because I was just too weak. A five hour drive to go to a barbecue was not my idea of fun and I have to go for my 3rd chemo thursday. When I explained why I could not go, my mom did not even acknowledge but was the first to call to tell me how much fun they had. Every time they come to our town, something happens like she told my 14 year old daughter to walk a mile in her shoes when my daughter was trying to explain the pain she had due to my having cancer. My brothers act like nothing is happening and when they came they got drunk. We had planned in January to go on a family trip to the east coast. This was supposed to be a 40th wedding anniversary party for my parents. We had to cancel the cottages and so on... I just found out that my parents and one of my brothers are still going and having the party. I explained that that was hurtful because I have cancer and we should have postponed this but they felt that they were going to proceed. I guess my question is how do I stay focused on getting well and beeing positive when I don't have any support. My husband and kids are great but they feel this strain as well. My son has lupus and always felt that because our family is so far away, they have no idea what we are going through every day. We struggle some days and what am I supposed to do call them and say, hey I'm having a bad day today. Why should I? I am so down and I can't seem to get back up. I was very positive but can't seem to get there again. The treatment has also put me into menopause so I might be feeling down because of that. Any suggestions on how to get positive and move on. take care everyone Kim Kim Metaplastic carcinoma, stage 2 , 2cm tumor, grade 3 triple neg Dx 4/11/2007, 2cm, Stage II, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I need emotional support kimvidito rspayne
How Do You Handle All of the Phone Calls? figsgirls joanne_elizabeth

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2007 09:27AM kimvidito wrote: I did tweak my chemo tx as I have a sick child at home and I ended up in the hospital during one of my last tx.  It is also not an option for me not to be home as my son needs a lot of care.  I spoke to my oncologist and he understood my circumstances and changed the tx. good luck Kim
